instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the research on constructing predictive models of flour milling yield (MY)% using image and spectral data captured from wheat samples?

Output: The machine learning techniques employed in the research on constructing predictive models of flour milling yield (MY)% using image and spectral data captured from wheat samples were multiple linear regression, support vector regression, and Gaussian process regression (GPR).

instruction: How accurate were the predictive models of flour milling yield (MY)% constructed using image and spectral data from wheat samples compared to traditional methods?
Output: The predictive models of flour milling yield (MY)% constructed using image and spectral data from wheat samples were found to be accurate compared to traditional methods. The combination of all features as input variables for a Gaussian process regression (GPR) model yielded the best accuracy, with adjusted-R-2 cross-validation values of 0.61 for MY%. The corresponding cross-validation root mean square error (RMSE) of the MY% model was 1.24%.
